### Additional Information:
The city of Balkh has been known by various names over time. The name Balkh was derived from the ancient Persian word *balka-, which referred to the region around the river Amu Daria. In modern Uzbek language it is still called "Balqox". Another possible source for its name could come from the Sogdian term 'bal-xo' meaning 'of or pertaining to the fortresses'. It may also derive from the proto-Indic words '*bhala-hka-', 'good-fortune', and 'kha-' place, land.
